availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Parker (Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer. Bourbon County, Kentucky, native. Married to Elizabeth Neal Parker. Father of Julia A. Parker, George W. Parker, Nancy Parker, Sarah Parker, Levina Parker, Henry Parker, John Parker, Elizabeth Parker, and Mollie Parker. Married to Elizabeth Teal Parker in Bourbon County, Kentucky, on May 19, 1856. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1850. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 504.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division, p. 133A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994028, Bourbon County Births.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994028, Bourbon County Marriages.
